body_html: I think for now it's safer to disallow passing tensors that require grad into the extensions. If they don't, they would get unwrapped in the binding code, and rewrapped again when going back to Python. At least this ensures that it's hard to shoot yourself in the foot, and all at::Tensors are really tensors. In the future we might want to add a unwrap_variables flag, which if set to false will ignore the unwrapping and rewrapping.

body: I think for now it's safer to disallow passing tensors that require grad into the extensions. If they don't, they would get unwrapped in the binding code, and rewrapped again when going back to Python. At least this ensures that it's hard to shoot yourself in the foot, and all `at::Tensor`s are really tensors. In the future we might want to add a `unwrap_variables` flag, which if set to false will ignore the unwrapping and rewrapping.
